intro: Munnozia glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular muhly, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial grass that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, spike-like clusters of white or pale blue flowers, which are borne on slender stalks. Its leaves are narrow and covered with fine, glandular hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Munnozia glandulosa is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
